items.title: Air Traffic Staffing Shortages Disrupt Travel for Second Straight Day
items.summary: The national air space has long been reeling from a staffing crisis among air traffic controllers, as the F.A.A. grapples with a shortage of about 3,000 controllers.

items.title: Trump Appoints New Head of Immigration Courts
items.summary: Col. Daren K. Margolin, who retired from the Marine Corps, was fired from a command position as head of security at Marine Base Quantico in 2013 for negligently firing a gun into the floor of his office.

items.title: Carney and Trump: A Collision Avoided, Save for a Nasty Comment or Two
items.summary: The Canadian prime minister came to Washington determined to take the heat out of the relationship. He mostly succeeded, at least for now.

items.title: 3 Key Takeaways From the Bondi Hearing
items.summary: The session before a Senate panel featured more fireworks than facts as Democrats and the attorney general repeatedly clashed.

items.title: Senate Confirms Neil Jacobs, ‘Sharpiegate’ Meteorologist, to Lead NOAA
items.summary: Neil Jacobs was found to have violated NOAA’s code of ethics after an investigation into an incident that centered on an altered hurricane forecast map in 2019.

items.title: Health Care Politics Bolster Democrats in Shutdown Fight
items.summary: Even President Trump has conceded that he and his party could face political pain from rising premiums, stiffening Democrats’ spines as they demand a subsidy extension.

items.title: Oregon’s governor says she told Kristi Noem ‘there is no insurrection in Oregon’ – as it happened
items.summary: <p>This liveblog is now closed. You can find more of our politics coverage <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-politics">here</a></p><p>Before we turn our attention to Capitol Hill, we’re also keeping an eye on Illinois today. On Monday, a federal judge did not immediately block the president’s move to deploy national guard troops, including hundreds from Texas, to Chicago.</p><p>Instead, the judge set a hearing for Thursday, leaving room for the military to make their way to the windy city as soon as today.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/07/donald-trump-national-guard-pam-bondi-mark-carney-government-shutdown-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Tesla debuts ‘affordable’ Model Y and 3 in US that strike some as too expensive
items.summary: <p>CEO Elon Musk touts SUV and sedan, with starting prices of $39,990 and $36,990, as way to tap wider swath of buyers</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/tesla">Tesla</a> rolled out “affordable” versions of its best-selling Model Y SUV and its Model 3 sedan, but the starting prices of US$39,990 and US$36,990 were too high, some said, to attract a new class of buyers to the electric vehicle brand.</p><p>CEO <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/elon-musk">Elon Musk</a> has touted the car as a way to tap a wider swath of buyers, saying last year that a price below $30,000, after incentives, was the key.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/07/tesla-affordable-model-y-3">Continue reading...</a>
